title: From Andrews to Zastudil: A Collection of The Plain Dealer Sportswriter Dennis Manoloff's Favorite Interviews via DMAN'S World
features: Interviews with sports legends and greats including Erin Andrews (television), Dr. James Andrews (sports medicine), Thea Andrews (television), Phil Bova (basketball), Roger Clemens (baseball), Jason Couch (bowling), Paula Creamer (golf), Ben Curtis (golf), Johnny Damon (baseball), Dennis Eckersley (baseball), John Farrell (baseball), Bob Feller (baseball), Jennie Finch (fast-pitch baseball), Allison Fisher (pool), Luis Gonzalez (baseball), Cammi Granato (hockey), Tonya Harding (skating), Padraig Harrington (golf), Franco Harris (football), Rickey Henderson (baseball), Torii Hunter (baseball), Zydrunas Ilgauskas (basketball), Derek Jeter (baseball), Chad Johnson (football), Randy Johnson & Curt Schilling (baseball), Shawn Johnson (gymnastics), Duane Kuiper & Rick Manning (baseball), Chuck Kyle (football), Cliff Lee (baseball), Tara Lipinski (skating), Nastia Liukin (gymnastics), Kenny Lofton (baseball), Charlie Manuel (baseball), Tim McCarver (baseball), Alyssa Milano (baseball), Kevin Millar (baseball), Dominique Moceanu (gymnastics), Joe Montana (football), Danica Patrick (auto racing), Johnny Pesky (baseball), Phil Pfister (strongman), Mary Lou Retton (gymnastics), Dave Roberts (baseball), Curt Schilling (baseball), Don Shula (football), Robert Smith (football), Joe Thomas (football), Jim Thome (baseball), Y.A. Tittle (football), Bill White (baseball), Venus & Serena Williams (tennis), Kristi Yamaguchi (skating), and Dave Zastudil (football)
description: Dennis Manoloff has been a sportswriter at

since August 1990. He covers primarily pro sports. He has written on more than fifteen sports/activities, including cricket and curling. He has covered two World Series, several PGA and LPGA championship events, the NBA Finals, MLB and NBA All-Star Games, and the NFL playoffs. He was on the field and hit by a bottle during the Bottlegate game at Cleveland Browns Stadium in 2001.

Among his beats was professional indoor soccer; the Crunch won three NPSL titles in the 1990s. Because pro indoor soccer does not count as a major sport, Dennis, who grew up in Bay Village, Oho, and graduated from Bay High School, has not seen a Cleveland team win a championship in his lifetime. He once coached former Browns punter Dave Zastudil, a Bay High graduate, in baseball.
In 2001, Dennis, a Northwestern University graduate, wrote a twenty-five-piece
series that ran weekly during the season.
nominated it for a Pulitzer Prize in explanatory journalism.

In 1998, he attempted to break the Guinness world record for most bowling pins knocked down in twenty-four hours. He fell woefully short but still managed 29,000 in twelve hours while raising several hundred dollars for charity.
